description: Alteration of Middle French perruque. Compare peruke, wig.

entries.meaning: (now historical) A wig, especially any kind of stylised wig as formerly worn by men and women. [from 16th c.]
examples: Grown stale, is to so low a value run,
That his dishevel'd beams and scattered fires
Serve but for ladies' periwigs and tyres

verbs.description: periwig (third-person singular simple present periwigs, present participle periwigging, simple past and past participle periwigged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To dress with a periwig, or with false hair; to bewig.
